Record.ClassificationPath: Virus Diseases/RNA Virus Infections/Mononegavirales Infections/Paramyxoviridae Infections/Morbillivirus Infections/Distemper
Record.Description: A name for several highly contagious viral diseases of animals, especially canine distemper. In dogs, it is caused by the canine distemper virus (DISTEMPER VIRUS, CANINE). It is characterized by a diphasic fever, leukopenia, gastrointestinal and respiratory inflammation and sometimes, neurologic complications. In cats it is known as FELINE PANLEUKOPENIA.
